title: NASA, NSIDC Scientists Say Arctic Winter Sea Ice at Record Low
summary: Winter sea ice cover in the Arctic was the lowest it’s ever been at its annual peak on March 22, 2025, according to NASA and the National Snow and Ice Data Center (NSIDC) at the University of Colorado, Boulder. At 5.53 million square miles (14.33 million square kilometers), the maximum extent fell below the prior […]

title: UK Must Foster Sovereign Launch Capability, Experts Tell Committee
summary:
A UK House of Lords special inquiry committee has heard from industry experts on the importance of fostering a sovereign launch capability. The UK Engagement with Space Committee was established by the House of Lords in January 2024. As a special inquiry committee, its primary aim is to examine how the UK can effectively engage […]

title: Finding Clues in Ruins of Ancient Dead Star With NASA’s Chandra
summary: People often think about archaeology happening deep in jungles or inside ancient pyramids. However, a team of astronomers has shown that they can use stars and the remains they leave behind to conduct a special kind of archaeology in space. Mining data from NASA’s Chandra X-ray Observatory, the team of astronomers studied the relics that […]

title: Proba-3's first autonomous formation flight
summary: Two spacecraft flying as one – that is the goal of European Space Agency’s Proba-3 mission. Earlier this week, the eclipse-maker moved a step closer to achieving that goal, as both spacecraft aligned with the Sun, maintaining their relative position for several hours without any control from the ground.

title: Cygnus mission to ISS scrapped after finding spacecraft damage
summary:
NASA and Northrop Grumman will not launch a Cygnus cargo mission to the ISS in June as previously planned after discovering the spacecraft is damaged.
The post Cygnus mission to ISS scrapped after finding spacecraft damage appeared first on SpaceNews.
